Business_AssetObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Business_AssetObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Business_AssetObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

description: Reference to the Business Asset which cost need to be adjusted

validation.validation: There is a pending event for the asset that should be completed before this asset transaction can be processed.
validation.description: There is a pending event for the asset that should be completed before this asset transaction can be processed.

validation.validation: Cannot adjust the cost of expense assets
validation.description: Cannot adjust the cost of expense assets

validation.validation: Cannot adjust the cost of this asset since accounting information has not been assigned yet
validation.description: Cannot adjust the cost of this asset since accounting information has not been assigned yet

validation.validation: Cannot adjust the cost of this asset since it is either disposed or pending disposal
validation.description: Cannot adjust the cost of this asset since it is either disposed or pending disposal

validation.validation: Cannot adjust the cost of this asset since it is out of service
validation.description: Cannot adjust the cost of this asset since it is out of service

validation.validation: Cannot adjust cost of an asset loaded into Workday as fully depreciated or transferred from a different company as fully depreciated
validation.description: Cannot adjust cost of an asset loaded into Workday as fully depreciated or transferred from a different company as fully depreciated

validation.validation: You cannot adjust the cost of this asset due to a problem with its depreciation start date not aligning with the first period in the depreciation schedule.  Please contact Support for assistance.
validation.description: You cannot adjust the cost of this asset due to a problem with its depreciation start date not aligning with the first period in the depreciation schedule.  Please contact Support for assistance.

validation.validation: Cannot adjust the cost of this asset since it has been removed
Cannot adjust the cost of this asset since asset status is Used By Composite
Cannot adjust the cost of Discrete Composite Asset.
There must be a complete supplier contract amendment for the asset before Workday can process this asset transaction.

Financials_Business_Process_Parameters.description: When set to "true" or "1", the business process is automatically processed. This means that all approvals will be automatically approved in the system, all reviews and to-do's will be automatically by-passed, and all notifications will be automatically suppressed.

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Free form comment regarding the business process.

validation.validation: This Business Process has been configured to disable comment. Please remove the comment or change the setting in the Business Process Policy or tenant setup.

WorkerObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

WorkerObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

WorkerObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Default the Person making the comment to the processing person if not submitted via the web service.

Financials_Business_Process_Parameters.description: Captures the Comment for the Business Process.

description: Business Process Parameters provide the ability to auto-submit to the business process.

Business_Asset_Cost_Adjustment_Data.description: Indicator to whether to perform Acquisition Adjustment or Post Acquisition Adjustment. Enter 0 for Acquisition Adjustment or 1 for Post Acquisition Adjustment.

validation.validation: Since this asset was converted into Workday, depreciation for the adjustment will be calculated starting on the Depreciation Start Date set at time of registration for any book with historical data
validation.description: Since this asset was converted into Workday, depreciation for the adjustment will be calculated starting on the Depreciation Start Date set at time of registration for any book with historical data

validation.validation: Since this asset was converted into Workday, depreciation for the adjustment will be calculated starting on the Depreciation Start Date set at time of registration for any book with historical data
validation.description: Since this asset was converted into Workday, depreciation for the adjustment will be calculated starting on the Depreciation Start Date set at time of registration for any book with historical data

validation.validation: Acquisition cost adjustment cannot be performed on assets with suspended periods
validation.description: Acquisition cost adjustment cannot be performed on assets with suspended periods

Business_Asset_Cost_Adjustment_Data.description: Date of cost adjustment (transaction effective date of the cost adjustment). This value is required if Post Acquisition Adjustment is 1.

validation.validation: Adjustment Date is required when Post Acquisition Adjustment is 1 (true). Similarly, Post Acquisition Adjustment must be 1 when Adjustment Date is entered.
validation.description: Adjustment Date is required when Post Acquisition Adjustment is 1 (true). Similarly, Post Acquisition Adjustment must be 1 when Adjustment Date is entered.

validation.validation: Adjustment Date cannot be less than Date Acquired of the Business Asset
validation.description: Adjustment Date cannot be less than Date Acquired of the Business Asset

validation.validation: Ledger Period must exist for the Adjustment Date.
validation.description: Ledger Period must exist for the Adjustment Date.

validation.validation: Depreciation start date for cost adjustment cannot be earlier than last resume date.
validation.description: Depreciation start date for cost adjustment cannot be earlier than last resume date.

validation.validation: The fiscal Period for the transaction date must exist in the fiscal schedule of every company asset book where this is a depreciable asset in order to do this transaction
validation.description: The fiscal Period for the transaction date must exist in the fiscal schedule of every company asset book where this is a depreciable asset in order to do this transaction

Business_Asset_Cost_Adjustment_Data.description: Adjustment amount. Can be positive or negative. Cannot bring total cost down to zero or negative

validation.validation: The adjustment amount entered has too many digits beyond the decimal point
validation.description: The adjustment amount entered has too many digits beyond the decimal point

validation.validation: You cannot reference supplier invoice line if adjustment amount is 0
For a converted or transferred asset, the sum of residual value and accumulated depreciation can't exceed the cost of the asset after adjustment.
The residual value can't exceed the cost of the asset after adjustment.
The adjustment amount isn't valid for this supplier invoice line for these asset books: [asset books].
validation.description: The adjustment amount isn't valid for the referenced supplier invoice line.

Business_Asset_Cost_Adjustment_Data.description: Adjustment quantity can be positive or negative.  You cannot bring total approved quantity to zero. You cannot bring total approved quantity to be less than consumed quantity.  Quantity adjustments apply to all asset books.

validation.validation: Quantity cannot be adjusted to be less than one.
validation.description: Quantity cannot be adjusted to be less than one.

validation.validation: Total new quantity cannot be less than consumed quantity of [consumed]
Quantity cannot be adjusted for Composite Assets.
Quantity cannot be adjusted for components of a discrete composite asset.

Business_Asset_Cost_Adjustment_Data.description: Adjustment residual value. Can be positive or negative but cannot bring down total residual to below 0.

validation.validation: The adjustment residual value entered has too many digits beyond the decimal point
validation.description: The adjustment residual value entered has too many digits beyond the decimal point

Business_Asset_Cost_Adjustment_Data.description: Accounting date when transaction was recorded in the ledger. Not required if source transaction is provided.

validation.validation: Accounting Date cannot be less than Date Acquired of the Business Asset
validation.description: Accounting Date cannot be less than Date Acquired of the Business Asset

Asset_BookObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Asset_BookObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Asset_BookObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Business_Asset_Cost_Adjustment_Data.description: Reference to asset books that are used by the asset. Enter asset books if you want to restrict the adjustment to specific books. To adjust all asset books, leave this field blank.

validation.validation: At least one of the Restricted to Books is not valid for asset. Only assets already defined and not loaded into Workday or transferred from different company fully depreciated are valid.
Restricted to Book is required when the asset has at least one fully depreciated book

Asset_Cost_Adjustment_ReasonObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Asset_Cost_Adjustment_ReasonObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Asset_Cost_Adjustment_ReasonObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Business_Asset_Cost_Adjustment_Data.description: Reference to an existing adjustment reason
A reference to a supplier invoice line, if there was one related to the cost adjustment associated with this asset, e.g. due to an improvement or installation cost.

validation.validation: Reference ID or Supplier Invoice Line Reference must refer to a valid Supplier Invoice Line.
You cannot reference a supplier invoice line when adjustment is restricted to non-accounting books
You must enter either Source Transaction or Accounting Date

The Supplier Invoice Line Reference for the adjustment must be for the same company, must be approved, amounts must be valid and the asset cannot have events in progress. The reference must be to a supplier invoice line.
You can't reference a supplier invoice line on an asset from a supplier contract.
